--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

2 warnings were generated during this run. See the warnings file [tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EAS_500/HsInv1256/output_warnings] for details.

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1702050917.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EAS_500/HsInv1258/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EAS_500/HsInv1258/input.gen.gz -int 47031935 47031935 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EAS_500/HsInv1258/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr12_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EAS_500/HsInv1258/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EAS_500/HsInv1258/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr12_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EAS_500/HsInv1258/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EAS_500/HsInv1258/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EAS_500/HsInv1258/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EAS_500/HsInv1258/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EAS_500/HsInv1258/output_warnings

## 4 OTHER FILES: Recombination map and strand file ###############
## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 60803222.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EAS_500/HsInv1321/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EAS_500/HsInv1321/input.gen.gz -int 65842837 65842837 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EAS_500/HsInv1321/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr14_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EAS_500/HsInv1321/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EAS_500/HsInv1321/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr14_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EAS_500/HsInv1321/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EAS_500/HsInv1321/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EAS_500/HsInv1321/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EAS_500/HsInv1321/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EAS_500/HsInv1321/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr14_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 517 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EAS_500/HsInv1321/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 3 individuals
 --read 1721 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region
 --excluded 1 SNPs, leaving 1720 SNPs for analysis
   --1 SNPs excluded for having no data

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EAS_500/HsInv1321/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 30 individuals
 --read 1536 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 449 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 1720 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 1087 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------
 Data summary 
--------------

[type 0 = SNP in Panel 0 only]
[type 1 = SNP in Panel 1]
[type 2 = SNP in Panel 2 and all ref panels]
[type 3 = SNP in Panel 2 only]

-Upstream buffer region
 --0 type 0 SNPs
 --0 type 1 SNPs
 --586 type 2 SNPs
 --311 type 3 SNPs
 --897 total SNPs

 --0 type 0 SNPs
 --0 type 1 SNPs
 --500 type 2 SNPs

 --0 type 0 SNPs
 --1 type 1 SNPs
 --0 type 2 SNPs
 --0 type 3 SNPs
 --1 total SNPs

-Output file
 --0 type 0 SNPs
 --1 type 1 SNPs
 --0 type 2 SNPs
 --0 type 3 SNPs

-In total, 1721 SNPs will be used in the analysis, including 1086 Panel 2 SNPs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 2 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 1 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-setting storage space
-setting mutation matrices
-setting switch rates

----------------
 Run parameters 
----------------

        reference diplotypes: 30 [Panel 1]
           study individuals: 3 [Panel 2]
           sequence interval: [65842837,65842837]
                      buffer: 250 kb
                          Ne: 20000
           input call thresh: 0.900
     burn-in MCMC iterations: 10
       total MCMC iterations: 30 (20 used for inference)
      HMM states for phasing: 58 [Panel 1]; 64 [Panel 2]
   HMM states for imputation: 60 [Panel 1->2]

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

1 warning was generated during this run. See the warnings file [tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EAS_500/HsInv1321/output_warnings] for details.

Have a nice day!

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0

Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 920482434.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EAS_500/HsInv1358/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EAS_500/HsInv1358/input.gen.gz -int 5595133 5595133 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EAS_500/HsInv1358/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr17_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EAS_500/HsInv1358/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EAS_500/HsInv1358/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr17_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EAS_500/HsInv1358/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EAS_500/HsInv1358/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EAS_500/HsInv1358/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EAS_500/HsInv1358/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EAS_500/HsInv1358/output_warnings

 --detected 31 individuals
 --read 1990 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

 --no SNPs removed

 --removed 584 SNPs

 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 1875 SNPs in Panel 2

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 1406 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 702497851.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EAS_500/HsInv1590/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EAS_500/HsInv1590/input.gen.gz -int 114259812 114259812 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EAS_500/HsInv1590/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr5_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EAS_500/HsInv1590/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EAS_500/HsInv1590/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr5_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EAS_500/HsInv1590/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EAS_500/HsInv1590/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EAS_500/HsInv1590/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EAS_500/HsInv1590/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EAS_500/HsInv1590/output_warnings

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 893782087.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EAS_500/HsInv1838/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EAS_500/HsInv1838/input.gen.gz -int 47654312 47654312 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EAS_500/HsInv1838/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr7_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EAS_500/HsInv1838/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EAS_500/HsInv1838/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr7_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EAS_500/HsInv1838/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EAS_500/HsInv1838/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EAS_500/HsInv1838/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EAS_500/HsInv1838/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EAS_500/HsInv1838/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr7_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 678 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EAS_500/HsInv1838/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 3 individuals
 --read 1832 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EAS_500/HsInv1838/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 31 individuals
 --read 1728 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 380 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 1832 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 1348 SNPs with data in multiple panels

-setting storage space

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EAS_500/HsInv1878/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EAS_500/HsInv1878/input.gen.gz -int 30954417 30954417 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EAS_500/HsInv1878/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr9_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EAS_500/HsInv1878/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EAS_500/HsInv1878/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr9_combined_b37.txt

             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EAS_500/HsInv1878/output_info_by_sample

 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EAS_500/HsInv1878/input.gen.gz]

 --read 1901 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-18_06_imputation/all14samps/imputationProcess/EAS_500/HsInv1878/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 45 individuals
 --read 2212 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 654 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 1901 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 1558 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
